subject: Re: Multithreaded test runner
msgSnippet: For the last 4 weeks I ve been working on a JUnit sampler for JMeter. The code is pretty stable at this point, but it s only available in the nightly build.
messageBody:
For the last 4 weeks I've been working on a JUnit sampler for JMeter.
The code is pretty stable at this point, but it's only available in
the nightly build.

you can see a screenshot of the sampler here

<img
src="http://people.apache.org/~woolfel/junitsampler-beta2.png">http://people.apache.org/~woolfel/junitsampler-beta2.png</a>

peter lin


--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, Alexandru Popescu
<alexandru.popescu@e...> wrote:
> #: by jason r tibbetts's words the mind was *winged* :#
> > Bradley, Todd wrote:
> >> Have you already looked at using an ActiveTestSuite instead of a
> >> TestSuite? It sped up our unit test execution time by tons.
> >
> > Thanks a million for pointing that out. I'd never noticed it
before, and
> > you're right--it sped things up considerably.
> >
>
> And in case you can consider some other solution I would suggest
(yes I know I am not objective
> enough ;-) ) taking a look at TestNG. It allows to configure the no
of parallel threads, the
> timeouts for every test method.
>
> :alex |.::the_mindstorm::.|
>
> >> ________________________________
> >>
> >> From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On
> >> Behalf Of Elliotte Harold
> >> Sent: Monday, July 04, 2005 12:06 PM
> >> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> >> Subject: [junit] Multithreaded test runner
> >>
> >>
> >> JUnit goes to great lengths to make tests independent of each
> >> other.
> >> Possibly this makes it more thread safe as well.
> >>
> >> Has anyone considered or written a multithreaded test runner?
> >> Given the
> >> amount of time my tests spend waiting for the network or doing
> >> I/O, not
> >> to mention the benefits of true multiprocessor system, I
> >> wouldn't be
> >> surprised if running multiple tests in parallel could cut
> >> execution time
> >> in half or more.
> >>
> >> In the most extreme case I've encountered, the full test suite
> >> takes
> >> couple of hours to run. However, that's almost all spent waiting
> >> for the
> >> network, so it would be extremely parallelizable. Has anyone
> >> done this?
> >>
> >> --
> >> Elliotte Rusty Harold elharo@m...
> >> XML in a Nutshell 3rd Edition Just Published!
> >> http://www.cafeconleche.org/books/xian3/
